div1.head: Senate Bill No. 1168, December 5, 1907
div1.opener:
60th Congress,
1st Session.
S. 1 1 6 8
IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES.
December 5, 1907.
Mr. Knox introduced the following bill; which was read twice and
referred to the Committee on Pensions.
____
December 5, 1907.
div1.p:
Granting a Pension to Mabel H. Lazear.
1 BE IT ENACTED BY THE SENATE AND HOUSE OF REPRESENTATIVES
2 OF THE UNITED STATES OF AMERICA IN CONGRESS ASSEMBLED,
3 That the Secretary of the Interior be, and he is hereby au-
4 thorized and directed to place on the pension roll, subject to
5 the provisions and limitations of the pension laws, the name
6 of Mabel H. Lazear, widow of Doctor Jesse W. Lazear, and
7 pay her a pension at the rate of one hundred and twenty-five
8 dollars per month in recognition of the services of the said
9 Jesse W. Lazear in discovering the theory of transmission
10 and propagation of yellow-fever infection by mosquitoes and
11 the sacrifice of his life in proving the same.
